intro: Tipularia cunninghamii, commonly known as the silverleaf tipularia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its leaves are elliptical and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in the eastern regions of Australia, including Queensland and New South Wales.
